qas.question: When was the capital of Armenia established?
What is the capital of Armenia?
The founding of which city was the first to be ever recorded?

context: Several bronze-era states flourished in the area of Greater Armenia, including the Hittite Empire (at the height of its power), Mitanni (South-Western historical Armenia), and Hayasa-Azzi (1500–1200 BC). The Nairi people (12th to 9th centuries BC) and the Kingdom of Urartu (1000–600 BC) successively established their sovereignty over the Armenian Highland. Each of the aforementioned nations and tribes participated in the ethnogenesis of the Armenian people. A large cuneiform lapidary inscription found in <a1_0>Yerevan<a1_0/> established that the modern capital of Armenia was founded in the summer of <a0_0>782 BC<a0_0/> by <a2_0>King Argishti I<a2_0/>. <a3_0>Yerevan<a3_0/> is the world's oldest city to have documented the exact date of its foundation.
